properties.abstract: At first we walk from Bergseehütte through a charming landscape full of granite debris and gaze up at the well-known, compact climbing mountain Bergseeschijen. The passage into the basin of the Voralpreuss calls on our climbing skills, as we need to scramble up a rocky step equipped with fixed ropes. Afterwards we traverse a wide face, which is occasionally stony, sometimes green, or even, depending on the season, snow-covered, to reach Voralphütte. A feast for the eyes are the high alpine Sustenhorn, the massive Fleckistock – the highest peak on Uri territory – and Salbitschijen, a summit highly sought after by ambitious sport climbers.
properties.subtitle: Passing by a well-known climbing mountain to Voralptal
properties.title: From Bergseehütte to Voralphütte

sac_photos.title: In the saddle at the foot of Horenfelistock, view to Voralptal. To the left of the signpost Sustenhorn is visible.
Ascending the last metres to the breach at P. 2600.
Shortly before the arrival: view to Voralphütte and the hiking trail leading to Göschenertal.
